pred: The group discussed the importance of channel selection being frequently used by users, making it a relevant function for the remote control. They considered features such as automatic on/off, gesture recognition for volume control, and personalized settings for each user. However, they acknowledged that implementing some of these features, like automatic on/off, might be difficult due to cost constraints and varying user preferences. The group agreed that channel selection should remain a primary and easily accessible function in the remote control design.
answers: The marketing thought it not easy to keep pressing 'next' to get to the channel people wanted. Then the user interface designer offered a solution that users could set up the channels that they often watched as one, two, and three so that they would never have to go through dozens of channels. However, in the Marketing's previous presentation, some people did love zapping, so the user interface designer suggested carrying out some research to find out how many people really needed to skip from one channel to another.

pred: A instructed the group to ensure their wireless mics were on and positioned correctly, approximately two thumb widths away from their mouths and at the corner, to minimize breath sounds. A also mentioned that everyone needed to fill out the speaker form and consent form only once, and that the transcripts would be anonymized in the text but not in the audio recordings. A emphasized the importance of keeping the meeting as natural as possible and not using aliases for participants. A explained the purpose of collecting the data, which includes a mock-up PDA for future meetings, and the use of both close talking and far field microphones to provide high-quality audio and ground truth for speech recognition research. A also discussed the intention to release the data to the public through a body like the Linguistic Data Consortium (LDC) and the collaboration with other institutions on related projects.
answers: A noted that all participants will have to sign a consent form and read out digits and requested that microphones be kept away from the mouth to minimize breathing sounds. A also mentioned that people will be anonymized in the transcript. A explained that the goal was to eventually be able to query meetings for information.

pred: The meeting was a kick-off session for designing a new television remote control. The project manager outlined the objectives, which included creating an original, trendy, modern, and friendly remote control. The process would involve three stages: functional, conceptual, and detailed design. The team discussed the tools available, such as Smartboards and software, and practiced using them by drawing animals. They also talked about the design specifications, such as using plastic for the case, rubber for the buttons, and an infrared beam for communication. The team agreed on the idea of having interchangeable fronts to make the remote more trendy and marketable. They planned to further discuss the specifics of the design during their next meeting in 30 minutes. The meeting concluded with plans to continue working individually before reconvening.
answers: The meeting was mainly about the exchange of the preliminary ideas about a new TV remote control project. They first got used to the writeboard and drew some animals with it.Project manager wanted to sell this remote control for twenty five Euro and expected profit will be around fifty million Euro. Afterwards the team raised different opinions about features of the new remote controls and related questions about market potential. Among all the features, having a good look and size were unanimously considered to be the most essential.

pred: Kirsty Williams acknowledged that there is still a challenge in recruiting teachers to the 300 priority places, despite efforts to improve the situation. She mentioned that they are taking a multi-faceted approach, including ensuring that Welsh teacher training centers are of world-class quality, providing financial incentives for graduates with the highest qualifications in priority subjects (up to £20,000 annually), launching a national recruitment marketing campaign for initial teacher education (ITE), and establishing an advisory board to investigate the underlying issues. Additionally, they are increasing the number of employment-based routes into qualified teacher status and introducing a part-time PGCE program to cater to individuals with diverse life experiences. These actions aim to address the complex factors influencing teacher recruitment and retention.
answers: Even though there was no specific figure that could be provided, they had only been recruiting about 65 percent of targets.Therefore, there was a lot of work they have to do about this. First, they were making sure that their ITE provision was world class, and recently they were through an accreditation process for a new ITE provision that would start in the next academic year. Second, they had looked at financial incentives.Third, they were embarking on their first national ITE recruitment marketing exercise. Kirsty Williams mentioned that this was not a unique issue in Wales, but a common issue across the globe. Money was not the only reason that prevented people from getting onto these courses. What's more, from next year, they would be going to have their unique part-time PGCE route into qualification, which allowed people to bring their outside world experience into teaching, and this could increase the diversity in their teaching workforce.

pred: The team discussed the use of advanced chips and LCD display in the remote control design. It was mentioned that using an LCD would increase costs significantly, and it might not be feasible given their budget. The team decided against using a kinetic battery and opted for a regular battery instead. The choice between an advanced chip with an LCD or a regular chip depended on whether a scroll wheel or joystick was included in the design. The team aimed to keep costs low while considering user preferences for younger people, such as soft matte materials, primary colors, curved and round shapes, and the use of a joystick-like design. The discussion also touched on the importance of making the remote control easily usable and durable.
answers: Industrial Designer introduced both simple chips and advanced chips could be used for the mouse. But it would require the use of LCD display, which would highly increase the cost. Project Manager agreed that the LCD was easy when using the scroll buttons and could see the number. But Project Manager argued that young people were less likely to have their own room to afford a LCD TV and decided not to choose the advanced ones.
